answers.answer: If your doctor isn't worried then you shouldn't be either.

I agree with the above. If your doctor isn't worried, you don't need to be either.Just keep taking your pre-natals. Andi think at this time in your pregnancy you're supposed to add a calcium supplement since the baby's bones are hardening. If you don't get enough calcium, the baby will take calcium from your bones.Lastly, with diabetes, I think you're supposed to keep your weight down. So the fact that you have only gained a modest amount of weight recently might be a good indication to your doctor. All my friends who had gestational diabetes had to watch what they ate very carefully and they barely gained any weight during the pregnancy.
I have diabetes as well. It's very normal. My weight has been same for a month or so.
yes. for a diabetic pregnancy (I've had 2) they really want you to limit weight gain.Most important is that your blood sugars are on target and that you are eating healthy.Only a few weeks to go.

question: I've only gained 2 lbs in 4 weeks and I'm 34 weeks. I have diabetes is this normal
title: 34 weeks Weight not up worried
